Module it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47
Package it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.network.socket

Class SocketServerProxy

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.network.socket.SocketServerProxy
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, Remote
public class SocketServerProxy extends Object implements VirtualServer
This class is a proxy for the server, it is used to send messages to the client through the socket connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketServerProxy

      public SocketServerProxy(OutputStream output) throws IOException
      Constructor for the class, it takes an output stream as parameter.
      Parameters:
      output - the output stream to write the messages to.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

  • Method Details

    • pingAck

      public void pingAck()
      This method is used to acknowledge a ping from the client. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "ping" to the message data, and then sends this message to the client through the output stream.

    • connect

      public int connect(VirtualView client)
      This method is intended to establish a connection with a client. However, in the current implementation, it is not used and simply returns 0.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      client - The client to connect to.
      Returns:
      Always returns 0 as the method is not implemented.

    • setNumOfPlayers

      public void setNumOfPlayers(int num)
      This method sets the number of players. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "numPlayers" and the provided number of players to the message data, and then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      setNumOfPlayers in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      num - The number of players to be set.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(int id, String nickname)
      This method is used to add a player to the game. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "addPlayer", the player's id and nickname to the message data, and then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      addPlayer in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the player to be added.
      nickname - The nickname of the player to be added.

    • drawStartingCard

      public StartingCard drawStartingCard()
      This method is used to draw a starting card. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "drawStarting" to the message data, and then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      drawStartingCard in interface VirtualServer
      Returns:
      Always returns null.

    • setStartingCardAndDrawObjectives

      public Objectives[] setStartingCardAndDrawObjectives(int playerId, StartingCard card)
      This method is used to draw an objective card. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "setStarting" the playerId and the startingCard to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      setStartingCardAndDrawObjectives in interface VirtualServer
      Returns:
      Always returns an empty array of Objectives.

    • setSecretObjective

      public void setSecretObjective(int playerId, Objectives obj)
      This method is used to set a secret objective. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "setObj" the playerId and the objective to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      setSecretObjective in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerId - The id of the player to set the objective for.
      obj - The objective to set.

    • startGameFromFile

      public void startGameFromFile()
      This method is used to start the game from file. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "startFromFile" to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      startGameFromFile in interface VirtualServer

    • playCard

      public boolean playCard(int onHandCard, int onTableCardX, int onTableCardY, int onTableCardCorner, int playerId, boolean isFront)
      This method is used to play a card. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "play", the onHandCard, onTableCardX, onTableCardY, onTableCardCorner, playerId and isFront to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      playCard in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      onHandCard - the card to play.
      onTableCardX - the x coordinate of the card on the table.
      onTableCardY - the y coordinate of the card on the table.
      onTableCardCorner - the corner of the card on the table.
      playerId - the id of the player playing the card.
      isFront - whether the card is played front or back.
      Returns:
      Always returns false.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(int position, int playerId)
      This method is used to draw a card. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "draw", the position and playerId to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      drawCard in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      position - the position to draw the card from.
      playerId - the id of the player drawing the card.

    • getCardsOnHand

      public ResourceCard[][] getCardsOnHand()
      This method is used to get the cards on hand. It creates a new SocketMessage, adds the string "getCardsOnHand" to the message data, then sends this message to the client through the output stream.
      Specified by:
      getCardsOnHand in interface VirtualServer
      Returns:
      Always returns the first element of an array of ResourceCard.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
